| **[Reference](/wiki/Source_code "Source code")**                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        | [SLASH'EM\_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line246](/wiki/SLASH%27EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line246 "SLASH'EM 0.0.7E7F2/monst.c") |

An **assassin bug** is a new insect in [SLASH'EM](/wiki/SLASH%27EM "SLASH'EM"). Although they can be seen randomly generated, they are most often summoned by the [summon insects](/wiki/Summon_insects "Summon insects") spell that [priests](/wiki/Aligned_priest "Aligned priest") and [devas](/wiki/Deva "Deva") cast.

## Strategy

Along with the stronger [migos](/wiki/Migo "Migo"), assassin bugs are a major reason that one cannot just ignore the summon insects spell and use it solely as a buffer, as is possible in vanilla NetHack. Assassin bugs are very fast, with a speed of 24, and are more than capable of dealing large amounts of damage, particularly to a character who is focusing on the [priest](/wiki/Aligned_priest "Aligned priest") next to them. A good strategy for dealing with summon insects is to take out the migo warriors, [killer beetles](/wiki/Killer_beetle "Killer beetle") and assassin bugs, and let the rest of the a serve as a buffer.

## Biology

This is a real insect. A terrestrial ambush predator, injecting lethal saliva that liquefies the insides of their prey, which they then suck out.

## Encyclopaedia entry

No entry.
html:
Assassin bug

From NetHackWiki
Jump to navigation Jump to search
a assassin bug
Difficulty 12
Attacks Bite 4d6 poison
a assassin bug
Difficulty 12
Attacks

Bite 4d6 poison

Base level 10
Base experience 236
Speed 24
Base AC 4
Base MR 0
Alignment 0 (neutral)
Frequency (by normal means) 1 (Very rare)
Genocidable Yes
Weight 100
Nutritional value 100
Size Large
Resistances poison
Resistances conveyed Poison (67%)

A assassin bug:

  • has no hands.
  • is an animal.
  • is poisonous to eat.
  • is carnivorous.
  • is normally generated hostile.
  • does not appear in Gehennom.
  • may turn against you when tame.
Reference SLASH'EM_0.0.7E7F2/monst.c#line246

An assassin bug is a new insect in SLASH'EM. Although they can be seen randomly generated, they are most often summoned by the summon insects spell that priests and devas cast.

Strategy

Along with the stronger migos, assassin bugs are a major reason that one cannot just ignore the summon insects spell and use it solely as a buffer, as is possible in vanilla NetHack. Assassin bugs are very fast, with a speed of 24, and are more than capable of dealing large amounts of damage, particularly to a character who is focusing on the priest next to them. A good strategy for dealing with summon insects is to take out the migo warriors, killer beetles and assassin bugs, and let the rest of the a serve as a buffer.

Biology

This is a real insect. A terrestrial ambush predator, injecting lethal saliva that liquefies the insides of their prey, which they then suck out.

Encyclopaedia entry

No entry.

An '''assassin bug''' is a new insect in [[SLASH'EM]].  Although they can be seen randomly generated, they are most often summoned by the [[summon insects]] spell that [[aligned priest|priests]] and [[deva|devas]] cast.

==Strategy==
Along with the stronger [[migo|migos]], assassin bugs are a major reason that one cannot just ignore the summon insects spell and use it solely as a buffer, as is possible in vanilla NetHack.  Assassin bugs are very fast, with a speed of 24, and are more than capable of dealing large amounts of damage, particularly to a character who is focusing on the [[aligned priest|priest]] next to them.  A good strategy for dealing with summon insects is to take out the migo warriors, [[killer beetle|killer beetles]] and assassin bugs, and let the rest of the {{white|a}} serve as a buffer.
